title: It's sad as you climb you realize a lot of the champions you played become obsolete
body:
I enjoy playing xin but now when I play him i'm just a liability for my team as the other team can pick champions like nidalee, kindred, and gragas that are just way more impactful and stronger than all the other junglers.

and i feel like this isn't just a problem for jungle, this is a problem for all the lanes. So many champions are just outclassed. Seriously outclassed this season. You can tell because of how skewed winrates are right now. SO many champions are just absolutely absurd must-ban but theres only 6 bans.

replies.body: ahri is one of the strongest champions if not the strongest ap mid in the game after that lux nerf

Ahri has almost always been a relevant mid laner. Same with Orianna. Yeah, they might not always be "top tier" but they are far from bad picks and remain to both usually be in the top 10-15 mid laners.
i think ori winrate is pretty low now. control mages aren't doing well in general. ahri however has one of the highest winrates in the game overall

Orianna's winrate has almost always been pretty low (except for when she was released, that was just blatantly overpowered). She is a rather team based champion, but is always a fairly strong pick and doesn't have that many bad match ups. She isn't Ahri or Lux strong right now, but I would definitely put her in the top 25% of mid laners where she usually is simply because of her reliability in a competent player.

The only time Orianna doesn't really do well is in a multi-tank meta since she is an AoE burst mage (that does have utility) and when they only have 1-2 threats it isn't worth picking her when you might only take out 1 damage threat.....might.
Win rate isn't a good indicator on really high skill floor champions. Most people are going to play like shit for at least 10 or so games.
And when the Hextech Rocket Belt goes live she will be a nightmare.
As an Ahri player, I don't see the hype around Rocketbelt.

Yeah I know right. All these people are hyping up rocket belt on these hyper mobile champions and I'm like but these champions are already balanced around their mobility and if i have 4 dashes why do I need an item with shitty stats for another. Its the ones who are immobile that you got to watch out for I think mid Cho'gath is just going to ROFLstomp with the item especially since they've been buffing his broken ass nonstop.
Not so sure but I think TF will be so scary with this item.
To be fair there's only like 3 viable AP Mids in the first place.

Jinx and Vayne are dead too. Just saying.
Jinx yes, Vayne not really. Unfavorable but not dead. She's doing better than Graves ADC (but not Graves everywhere else obviously)

Jinx and Vayne depend on the bot lane "meta" too much. When bot lane is mainly late game carries they do perfectly fine (sooooo like all of s5). When bot lane favors early game dominance (Lucian, Ezreal, hell even Kog hits his power spike at 2800) then they just get bullied and are never allowed to scale.

Why does kog powerspike before Vayne? He definatly shouldn't powerspike before Jinx.

Jinx is also supposed to be somewhat of a lane bully with her Q rockets, though that has been nerfed. 

She's weak as she is squishy, has no mobility to escape the bursty asssassins, and doesn't have enough damage to get through the tanks, and doesn't kite well without her passive up. She gets locked down easily too.

no no, that's actually fine.

jinx and vayne should both probably be locked as late game only or terribad spots, because they are both cancer if they aren't, for different reasons of course.

jinx breaks towers too fast, she always has, and vayne has the most of the most broken an unbalanced disaster of a damage style in the game, and should be pretty easily punished in general due to it.

Why? Because his core items barely break 5000 gold (5400 for both Rageblade and Hurricane) while Jinx and Vayne need 6350/6400 to be somewhat relevant in terms of damage (IE+PD/Hurricane).

Kog actually is a mid game champion now since he really doesn't scale well in terms of damage (zero scalings of note on abilities outside of R execute) and Crit is terrible since 250% of 55% is lackluster at best. He is a sustained damage dealer that gets the damage necessary to be relevant (Rageblade+Hurricane) and then just gets bulky so he can pelt you for longer (which is why he usually goes for items like Steraks).
Plus kog deals mostly mix damage so he can't easily itemize for penetration late game

This is actually easily argued as a benefit: His mixed damage means that he can't really be itemized AGAINST, either. At least, not targeted itemization. Which means his damage is relatively consistent, which is quite a boon.

Similarly, a lot of Corki's strength comes from the same mixed damage output.

It's a trade off that pushes him farther into "midgame champion" territory.

Midgame, mixed damage is stronger as there isn't good direct itemization to deal with it, but lategame it's a bit weaker as the tanks and bruisers get full build with sufficient resists.

I know this isn't just a jungle problem, but it does seem like this rings true for jungle more than any other role. These junglers for example {{champion:266}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:57}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:72}} {{champion:56}} {{champion:19}} are unique, fun to play, and have distinct strengths and weaknesses in the jungle. But that's the problem: they're TOO balanced, or in the case of some, too weak and too exploitable in higher level play. 

I'm not saying they can't work at all; I bet there are some Fiddle jungle mains in diamond, or Skarner jungle mains in master, etc. But when you're objectively comparing and contrasting champions, jungle is probably the least diverse role in the game. Why play Shaco when you can play Lee Sin? Why play Aatrox when you can play Master Yi? Why play Nocturne when you can play Vi? And so on. 

Top lane kinda has this problem too, but at least there if the enemy picks Quinn you can pick Graves or Irelia. But if the enemy jungler picks Lee Sin..........who the hell counters Lee in the jungle?

I dunno, I kind of like being an unstoppable duelist with infinite sustain late game.

Shyv an YI have huge weaknesses, they just build Devo either faster, an/or benefit more then other champs do.

The jg's with no weakness hardly jungle at all and are 10%farm/40%ward bot/50% gank pressure

Supports have it way worst.
You have to pick something that counter the entire enemy team and that doesn't get countered by your own team. Not just your lane.

Unlike other roles, Supports are gold and XP starved, putting them at risk of dying to any champion that have even the slightest of advantage over them when it comes to ability interactions. Once you left lane, you are already behind every other lane, even if you won your lane while the other enemy lanes lost their... because less XP and absolutely no gold.

First pick? Guess I have to play Janna... AGAIN.

To be fair, you can be competitive and carry with any champion, it's just more difficult. Ask any great player and they'll tell you the way to climb is to play the champions you're good at, not the FotM or "freelo" champions. I'm sure everyone has had that First Time Riven in Ranked who doesn't even know how to play the champion.

This one. This is exactly what I tell my friends since if you really like your champion and do well on them you will almost ALWAYS best the FotM champs. This is for 2 reasons mainly. A) you know your champion better than they do (this is almost always guaranteed) and B) you know the lane match up WAY better than they do (last season I played Akali vs Darius so many times that it is not even THAT hard of a counterpick anymore whereas the Darius doesn't even know what an Akali is or does).

This is easier to do on "better" champions, but is not impossible on the fairly weak and "bad" ones (you might be able to kind of carry after 100+ games on someone like Aatrox, but I won't put my faith in you carrying me regardless).

You're really, really, really, really, really, really stupid for saying that.

You're calling him a "retard" when he's top 1% of the playerbase for not going against -bots- to learn.

You don't learn how to play at a Diamond level with new Champions from -bots-.

Who the actual fuck thinks you can learn from -bots- at how to better play Champions at a Diamond level.

Oh. Silver 3.

Gameplay and Balance in a nutshell boys. Silver 3, says something really stupid, calls a Diamond player who is calibers above them in level "retarded" because they flat out are incapable of understanding the arguments at hand. 

Okay. Since you don't understand, let me actually break it down for you since you have a lack of experience.

Mechanics at a very, very, very basic level can be practiced in bots. By this I mean uh. Bronze and low Silver. That's it. 

Outside of that, you  learn how to mechanically outplay people when you're going against people at your level.

The issue is you can't do that outside of Ranked when you're top 1%. Because you have to face them in Ranked-- even -if- your Normals MMR is that level (and a lot of high rated players don't have high high rated Normals MMR because they don't give a shit in Normals), they're -still- unlikely to be providing the level of play you need to against to learn. Because they're likely doing the same thing, or, just not giving a fuck.

So if you can't go against people who are (and I seriously hate this word) "tryharding" outside of Ranked, then you want to learn how to play someone at that level because a Champion counters your pool, what do you do?

You can learn more Champions but to get that good it's not done overnight. It's done over a long, long, long period. To deal with a single Champion who could very well be nerfed right the next patch.

Or you can learn to deal with your counter, but it's significantly harder to learn at that level. Plus you're still countered and even though you may learn how to deal with it, a counter is a counter nonetheless and it'll still impact your winrate.

Gragas -is- stupid right now and -is- making it hard to deal with a lot of shit in games. He -is- a problem.

Telling someone they're a retard because they aren't using the AI to learn things is uh. Retarded.

The -only- thing "bot matches" are good for is learning stuff like animation canceling (Riven basically) and new Jungle routes.

You don't even do "bot matches" for those, you make custom games with only yourself. And those are the bare, bare, bare basics that still get you nowhere near Diamond level in the slightest.

But I don't know what else I'd expect from a Silver 3.

Nasus is still my favorite champion, but I just can't play him anymore, not in ranked at least. At this point I only pick him if Darius is banned. You have to pray your team doesn't feed early and then wait 15 minutes before you can actually start stomping your opponent, can't stop them from TP'ing in front of you to go get their botlane fed, it feels like you get shredded to nothing in teamfights regardless of your tank items, can't splitpush thanks to no wards and death timers, Master Yi, etc. For every reason I can think of to pick Nasus, I can give 5 reasons not to. Can't remember the last time I did well on Nasus, played Garen for the 1st time in months, went 16/1, killed the fed midlaner who usually dooms Nasus, and it all took about 1/3rd the effort.

Even SirHcez hardly plays him anymore, and he loses every game when he does.
